New Mexico Students to Speak with NASA A.title: New Mexico Students to Speak with NASA Astronaut Aboard Space Station
New Mexico Students to Speak with NASA A.desc: Students from New Mexico will have an opportunity next week to talk with a NASA astronaut currently living and working aboard the International Space Station.

Interns Express Themselves Through NASA.title: Interns Express Themselves Through NASA Projects
Interns Express Themselves Through NASA.desc: Interns Express Themselves Through NASA Projects

NASA, University of Alabama to Collabora.title: NASA, University of Alabama to Collaborate on Advanced, In-space Manufacturing
NASA, University of Alabama to Collabora.desc: NASA’s Marshall Space Flight Center in Huntsville, Alabama, is expanding its partnership with the University of Alabama in Tuscaloosa, to collaborate on advanced and in-space manufacturing.

NASA Selects Minority-Serving Institutio.title: NASA Selects Minority-Serving Institutions to Advance Aerospace Manufacturing
NASA Selects Minority-Serving Institutio.desc: The Minority University Research and Education Project (MUREP) of NASA’s Office of STEM Engagement is partnering with the agency’s Aeronautics Research Mission Directorate to provide students at minority-serving institutions the education and experience needed to help address manufacturing needs in the U.S. aerospace sector.

NASA Deputy Administrator, Astronaut Can.title: NASA Deputy Administrator, Astronaut Candidate to Visit University of North Carolina
NASA Deputy Administrator, Astronaut Can.desc: NASA Deputy Administrator Jim Morhard and astronaut candidate Zena Cardman will visit the University of North Carolina at Chapel Hill (UNC-Chapel Hill) Wednesday to Thursday, Nov. 6-7, to discuss the agency’s Artemis program.

Maine Students to Speak with NASA Astron.title: Maine Students to Speak with NASA Astronaut Aboard Space Station
Maine Students to Speak with NASA Astron.desc: Students from Maine will have an opportunity next week to talk live with a NASA astronaut aboard the International Space Station.

NASA Administrator Invites Public to Upd.title: NASA Administrator Invites Public to Update on Agency’s Return to Moon
NASA Administrator Invites Public to Upd.desc: The public is invited to join NASA Administrator Jim Bridenstine at 9:40 a.m. EDT Friday, Oct. 25, for an update on the agency’s Artemis program and the critical role international partnerships have in returning astronauts to the Moon and going on to Mars.

Maryland, Washington Students to Speak w.title: Maryland, Washington Students to Speak with NASA Astronaut Aboard Space Station
Maryland, Washington Students to Speak w.desc: Students from Maryland and Washington, D.C., will have an opportunity this week to talk with a NASA astronaut currently living and working aboard the International Space Station.

IAC 2019: Where NASA STEM, Young Profess.title: IAC 2019: Where NASA STEM, Young Professionals, Students and YOU Fit In
IAC 2019: Where NASA STEM, Young Profess.desc: The International Astronautical Congree welcomes students from all over the world, granting them opportunities to present research, gain new insight and ideas, and network with space policy professionals from around the globe.

NASA to Provide Coverage of Key Events a.title: NASA to Provide Coverage of Key Events at 70th International Astronautical Congress
NASA to Provide Coverage of Key Events a.desc: NASA will provide live coverage on NASA Television of key events at the 70th International Astronautical Congress (IAC), which takes place Oct. 21-25 at the Walter E. Washington Convention Center in Washington.

NASA Selects Informal Learning Instituti.title: NASA Selects Informal Learning Institutions to Engage Next Generation
NASA Selects Informal Learning Instituti.desc: NASA’s Teams Engaging Affiliated Museums and Informal Institutions (TEAM II) program has selected four informal education organizations to promote STEM learning and help inspire the next generation of explorers.

NASA Named Best Place to Work in Federal.title: NASA Named Best Place to Work in Federal Government for 8th Straight Year
NASA Named Best Place to Work in Federal.desc: For the eighth consecutive year, NASA has been selected by the Partnership for Public Service as the Best Place to Work in Government. The rankings, announced Tuesday, reflect NASA’s unified focus and dedication to sending humans farther into space than ever before, and the agency’s highest employee satisfaction results since this index was develop

New NASA eBook Reveals Insights of Earth.title: New NASA eBook Reveals Insights of Earth Seen at Night from Space
New NASA eBook Reveals Insights of Earth.desc: Earth has many stories to tell, even in the dark of night. Earth at Night, NASA’s new 200-page ebook, is now available online and includes more than 150 images of our planet in darkness as captured from space by Earth-observing satellites and astronauts on the International Space Station over the past 25 years.

International Students to Speak with NAS.title: International Students to Speak with NASA Astronauts Aboard Space Station
International Students to Speak with NAS.desc: International students in Panama will have an opportunity this week to talk with NASA astronauts aboard the International Space Station.

Texas Students to Speak with NASA Astron.title: Texas Students to Speak with NASA Astronauts Aboard Space Station
Texas Students to Speak with NASA Astron.desc: Students from Texas will have an opportunity this week to talk with three NASA astronauts aboard the International Space Station.

NASA\u2019s Newest Astronauts Ready for.title: NASA’s Newest Astronauts Ready for Space Station, Moon, and Mars Missions
NASA\u2019s Newest Astronauts Ready for.desc: NASA welcomed 11 new astronauts to its ranks Friday, increasing the number of those eligible for spaceflight assignments that will expand humanity’s horizons in space for generations to come.

2020 FIRST Robotics Kickoff Event Return.title: 2020 FIRST Robotics Kickoff Event Returns to Rocket City Jan. 4
2020 FIRST Robotics Kickoff Event Return.desc: More than 260 students are expected to attend the 2020 FIRST Robotics kickoff event Jan. 4, starting 8:30 a.m. at the U.S. Space & Rocket Center in Huntsville, Alabama.

NASA to Pay Tribute to Fallen Heroes wit.title: NASA to Pay Tribute to Fallen Heroes with Day of Remembrance
NASA to Pay Tribute to Fallen Heroes wit.desc: NASA will honor members of the NASA family who lost their lives while furthering the cause of exploration and discovery, including the crews of Apollo 1 and space shuttles Challenger and Columbia, during the agency's annual Day of Remembrance Thursday, Jan. 30.

NASA Invites Public to Be Its Guests to.title: NASA Invites Public to Be Its Guests to Celebrate Historic ‘Launch America’
NASA Invites Public to Be Its Guests to.desc: NASA is inviting the public to help celebrate a historic milestone in human spaceflight as it prepares for #LaunchAmerica – the first flight into orbit of American astronauts on American rockets from American soil since the end of the space shuttle era in 2011.

NASA Funds Artemis Student Challenges to.title: NASA Funds Artemis Student Challenges to Inspire Space Exploration
NASA Funds Artemis Student Challenges to.desc: NASA will award nearly $2.4 million to universities as part of the Artemis Student Challenges, a bold new initiative to inspire the next generation – the Artemis Generation.

Educators to Speak with NASA Astronaut A.title: Educators to Speak with NASA Astronaut Aboard Space Station
Educators to Speak with NASA Astronaut A.desc: Educators from across the nation will have an opportunity next week to talk with a NASA astronaut aboard the International Space Station.

NASA Interns to Speak with NASA Astronau.title: NASA Interns to Speak with NASA Astronaut Aboard Space Station
NASA Interns to Speak with NASA Astronau.desc: Students participating in NASA internships will have an opportunity next week to talk with a NASA astronaut aboard the International Space Station.

NASA Astronaut, Air Force General to Tal.title: NASA Astronaut, Air Force General to Talk with Students About Future of Air, Space
NASA Astronaut, Air Force General to Tal.desc: NASA astronaut Nick Hague and Air Force Maj. Gen. Jeannie Leavitt will discuss leadership for the future of air and space through an online educational opportunity at noon EDT Thursday, April 16.

NASA Announces Cooperative Agreements fo.title: NASA Announces Cooperative Agreements for Research and Technology Projects
NASA Announces Cooperative Agreements fo.desc: NASA has awarded approximately $12.2 million to colleges, universities and other organizations nationwide for research and technology development projects in areas critical to the agency’s mission.

Maine Students to Speak with NASA Astron.title: Maine Students to Speak with NASA Astronauts Aboard Space Station
Maine Students to Speak with NASA Astron.desc: Students from Maine will have an opportunity next week to talk with NASA astronauts aboard the International Space Station who have special ties to the Pine Tree State.

New NASA Podcast Helps Listeners Explore.title: New NASA Podcast Helps Listeners Explore Our ‘Curious Universe’
New NASA Podcast Helps Listeners Explore.desc: NASA’s newest podcast is taking listeners on an adventure to explore the wonders of Earth and help unravel the mysteries of the universe.

Food, Technology for ISS at the Judges\u.title: Food, Technology for ISS at the Judges’ Table at Annual HUNCH Competition
Food, Technology for ISS at the Judges\u.desc: Teams of high school students took part in a nationwide program to put their best entrée and technologies forward as part of NASA’s HUNCH program.

New York City Students to Speak with NAS.title: New York City Students to Speak with NASA Astronaut Aboard Space Station
New York City Students to Speak with NAS.desc: Students from New York City will have an opportunity this week to talk with a NASA astronaut aboard the International Space Station.

Maryland Students, Navy Pilots to Hear f.title: Maryland Students, Navy Pilots to Hear from NASA Astronauts in Space
Maryland Students, Navy Pilots to Hear f.desc: Pilots from the U.S. Naval Test Pilot School in Patuxent River, Maryland, and students across southern Maryland will have an opportunity this week to hear from NASA astronauts aboard the International Space Station.

NASA Langley STEM Outreach Pays Dividend.title: NASA Langley STEM Outreach Pays Dividends with Virginia Beach Schools
NASA Langley STEM Outreach Pays Dividend.desc: Students took part in a variety of activities with Langley subject matter experts related to landing humans on the Moon via the Artemis mission and modeling a spacecraft docking station.

SOAR High School Student Wins NASA Armst.title: SOAR High School Student Wins NASA Armstrong Scholarship
SOAR High School Student Wins NASA Armst.desc: The NASA Armstrong Employee Exchange Council presented the 2022 John W. Russell Memorial Scholarship Award to Katelyn Perez.

NASA Langley Welcomes Virginia Teachers.title: NASA Langley Welcomes Virginia Teachers as Part of 2022 MODSIM Program
NASA Langley Welcomes Virginia Teachers.desc: Nearly a dozen middle- and high-school math educators from across Virginia spent June 23 at Langley - a culminating experience after a year of virtual online work in these areas using online sessions in Microsoft TEAMS, digital badges and other webinars.

NASA Interns\u2019 First Day at Goddard.title: NASA Interns’ First Day at Goddard
NASA Interns\u2019 First Day at Goddard.desc: From working at home to a hybrid internship, Goddard welcomes the triumphant return of some students.

NASA Administrator, STEM Partner Connect.title: NASA Administrator, STEM Partner Connect Orlando Children with Artemis
NASA Administrator, STEM Partner Connect.desc: NASA Administrator Bill Nelson helped hand out food with an extra serving of STEM activities to children and families at New Beginnings Church – The Gathering Place in Orlando, Florida, on Friday, June 3.

NASA Selects Minority-Serving Institutio.title: NASA Selects Minority-Serving Institution Proposals to Receive Support
NASA Selects Minority-Serving Institutio.desc: The awardees in the first MSI Space Accelerator have been announced after a competitive application process in which they were encouraged to think like startup businesses.

NASA Administrator to Launch Artemis Lea.title: NASA Administrator to Launch Artemis Learning Lunchbox Initiative
NASA Administrator to Launch Artemis Lea.desc: NASA Administrator Bill Nelson is helping kick off a new initiative to deliver food and hands-on science, technology, engineering, and math kits, called Learning Lunchboxes, in Orlando at 10:30 a.m. EDT on Friday, June 3.

NASA Administrator, Arizona Students to.title: NASA Administrator, Arizona Students to Hear from Station Astronauts
NASA Administrator, Arizona Students to.desc: Students from Arizona will have an opportunity this week to hear from astronauts aboard the International Space Station.

NASA Administrator to Visit Florida Stud.title: NASA Administrator to Visit Florida Students, Industry
NASA Administrator to Visit Florida Stud.desc: NASA Administrator Bill Nelson will speak to elementary school students about the future of space exploration Monday, May 9, and tour a lab working on robotic construction technologies Tuesday, May 10, during a trip to Florida.
